thread.title: New: Pay what you want Learn to Hack complete package
thread.title_full: New: Pay what you want Learn to Hack complete package

author: AA Picks
title: New: Pay what you want Learn to Hack complete package
text:
The AAPicks team writes about things we think you’ll like, and we may see a share of revenue from any purchases made through affiliate links. 

If you’ve ever wanted to set aside your label as go-to tech guy and actually learn how to actually bend networks and remote computers to your will, now might be your chance!
Tech Deals currently has a Humble Bundle-style bundle of 8 ethical hacking learning packages going for whatever you want to pay. Even if that’s only $1! 
Become a security expert with a potentially lucrative skillset under your belt.
Granted, the nature of these Pay What You Want offers means that in order to snag the full line of courses, you’ll have to pay more than the current average. Of course this means that the price of this bundle will gradually rise , so if you want to snag the best deal you’ll have to pounce quickly.
At the time of writing, you could get all 8 courses for around $15 .
What you get for $1 Python For Android Hacking Crash Course: Trojan Perspective $199 Wi-Fi Hacking with Kali $200 What you get if you beat the average The Complete Ethical Hacking Course for 2017 $249 Learn Ethical Hacking From Scratch $180 Networks from Scratch to Advanced Implementation $149 Certified Information Systems Security Professional $149 Information Security Management Fundamentals $95 Web Security: Common Vulnerabilities and Their Mitigation $50 Ready to learn the secret side of computer security? Check the current going average by clicking over here !
Is this deal not quite right for you? Head over to the AAPICKS HUB for more savings you’re going to love! For notifications of offers and price drops, sign up for our Deal Alerts newsletter. We may get a small percent from purchases made through our posts. However, the AA Picks team only showcases verified, legitimate deals. It’s a nice way to help keep the lights on around here, and it decreases our reliance on pesky ads. If you have questions or concerns, please reach out at aapicks@androidauthority.com .
